page.title: 16A Friendly Ghost.
page.content: Pheasants Coombe cottage was once three small houses built 300 years ago.When the present occupier first went to live there,she developed bronchitis and she called in the doctor.He asked her how she was getting on with her poltergeist Peter Pheasant. Peter Pheasant was a very friendly old man who once owned part of the cottage.The lady of the house noticed that a large lamp shade kept falling off and a strip light in an alcove was disliked by Peter.The light was always going out even after the wiring had been checked.Guests who stayed overnight and who brought bedside clocks found the clock on its face the next morning.Peter is friendly and the owner talks to him.He has never broken anything although a valuable brooch and a cut crystal tumbler have been spirited away.
